title: Liverpool talent Kevin Stewart insists time away in Spain will help Reds gel and improve performances - Mirror Online
text:

Liverpool talent Kevin Stewart has heaped praise on Jurgen Klopp for sending the squad to Spain during their mid-season break. 
The Reds were dumped out of the FA Cup by Wolves in the fourth round, meaning a two-week gap without a game. 
Liverpool have been training at the La Manga resort in a bid to snap out of their slump and push on for a top four finish and Stewart insists it has been a beneficial experience. 
"I think it's really good to do something different," Stewart told Liverpoolfc.com. "A lot of new players came in this season and people coming up from the Academy, so not everyone knew each other too well. Jurgen Klopp oversees training at the La Manga resort (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More Liverpool transfer news and rumours: 'Reds to battle Real Madrid for Julian Brandt' 
"I think these kind of trips are really good to connect with people, spend more time with [them], get to know each other and gel together. I think it will help performances." 
Liverpool will travel to Leicester on Monday and could find themselves in sixth place and four points off the top four, but Stewart insists they will be ready due to the intensity of the training. The Reds have been working hard in Spain (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More Liverpool's Melwood move is the latest step in Jurgen Klopp's behind-the-scenes revolution for the club 
"No matter what we do, we're always keeping an eye on the football and trying to improve," Stewart added.
